device_mount: Handheld; Placed loosely around user (e.g., table)
devices_included: Any device in the surrounding; Printer; Any screen device
use_cases_desc:
- connecting to a printer
- pairing laptops in a meeting
- pairing / communicating with public displays
contribution_desc:
The paper introduces the RELATE interaction model, which allows to pair mobile devices with other devices and devices in their surrounding through discovery of relative positioning of devices. The spatial references of devices are displayed in a visualisation and allow to match network identities with physical identities. 
The tracking technology has been used in prior publication [13] to show devices on a 2D map. In this paper, the authors display relative locations, around the main device's screen to indicate presence, location, and function of other devices around. The user can then interact with them, using direct touch interaction.
